me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.geometry

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.geometry.Line
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Line
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A line SEGMENT - this is not a line, this is a line segment. If you want an infinite line, see LinearEquation. This is the basis for polygonal geometry.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Colin Robertson
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getUnboundedIntersection

        public static PointXY getUnboundedIntersection(Line a,
                                               Line b)
        Get the unbounded point of intersection between two lines. This ignores the line's "boundaries" - it doesn't matter if the point is actually on the line segment, it just matters that it's on the line's linear equation.
        Parameters:
        a - one of the two lines.
        b - one of the two lines.
        Returns:
        the unbounded point of intersection between the two lines. If the lines do not intersect, return null.

      • areLinesParallel

        public static boolean areLinesParallel(Line a,
                                       Line b)
        Are two lines parallel? (Do they have the same slope?)
        Parameters:
        a - one of the two lines.
        b - one of the two lines.
        Returns:
        if the lines are parallel, true. Otherwise, false.

      • doLinesIntersect

        public static boolean doLinesIntersect(Line a,
                                       Line b)
        Do two lines intersect ON the line segment?
        Parameters:
        a - one of the two lines.
        b - one of the two lines.
        Returns:
        if the lines intersect at a point on both of the segments, return true. Otherwise, return false.

      • getIntersection

        public static PointXY getIntersection(Line a,
                                      Line b)
        Get the point of intersection between two lines. If the lines intersect at a point not on both of the lines, this method will return null.
        Parameters:
        a - one of the two lines.
        b - one of the two lines.
        Returns:
        get the point of intersection between two lines. If the lines don't have any valid points of intersection, return null.

      • isPointOnLine

        public static boolean isPointOnLine(Line line,
                                    PointXY point)
        Is a point on a line? This checks to see if the given point is collinear with the given line's start and end points. In other words, it doesn't check to see if the point is on the line SEGMENT - just the line.
        Parameters:
        line - the line to test.
        point - the point to test.
        Returns:
        if the point is collinear with both the start and end points, true. Otherwise, false.

      • isPointOnLineSegment

        public static boolean isPointOnLineSegment(Line line,
                                           PointXY point)
        Is a point on a line segment?
        Parameters:
        line - the line to test.
        point - the point to test.
        Returns:
        if the point is on the line segment, true. Otherwise, false.

        Parameters:

        line - the line to use.
        Returns:
